trans-unit.source: Enables the user to select a single option from a group of choices when paired with other <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton"></xref> controls.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> control can display text, an <xref:System.Drawing.Image>, or both.
When the user selects one option button (also known as a radio button) within a group, the others clear automatically.
All <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> controls in a given container, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>, constitute a group.
To create multiple groups on one form, place each group in its own container, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBox> controls have a similar function: they offer choices a user can select or clear.
The difference is that multiple <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckBox> controls can be selected at the same time, but option buttons are mutually exclusive.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.Checked%2A> property to get or set the state of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton>.
The option button's appearance can be altered to appear as a toggle-style button or as a standard option button by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.Appearance%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton"></xref> class.
The default view of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> has its text aligned to the right of the button and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.AutoCheck%2A> property is set to `true`.
Gets or sets a value determining the appearance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton"></xref>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.Appearance%2A> value is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Appearance.Normal>, then the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> control is drawn with a circular check box.
If the value is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Appearance.Button>, then the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> is drawn as a control that can be toggled to an up or down state.
Either type can display text, an image, or both.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Appearance"></xref> values.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Appearance.Normal"></xref>.
The assigned value is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Appearance"></xref> values.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.Appearance"></xref> property value changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.Checked"></xref> value and the appearance of the control automatically change when the control is clicked.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.Checked%2A> value is set to `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> portion of the control must be checked in code in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click> event handler.

In addition, if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> is part of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> control group, this property ensures that only one of the controls is checked at a given time.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.AutoCheck%2A> property is set to `false`, a group of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> controls will not act as a mutually exclusive group and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.Checked%2A> property must be updated in code.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.Checked"></xref> value and the appearance of the control automatically change on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click"></xref> event; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Gets or sets the location of the check box portion of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton"></xref>.
One of the valid <xref href="System.Drawing.ContentAlignment"></xref> values.
The default value is <xref href="System.Drawing.ContentAlignment.MiddleLeft"></xref>.
The assigned value is not one of the <xref href="System.Drawing.ContentAlignment"></xref> values.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control is checked.
`true` if the check box is checked; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.Checked"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Creates a new accessibility object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton"></xref> control.

If you do not explicitly call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method, it will be called when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibilityObject%2A> property is referenced.
To get or set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibilityObject%2A> property, you must add a reference to the <xref:Accessibility> assembly installed with the .NET Framework.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.RadioButtonAccessibleObject"></xref> for the control.
Gets the required creation parameters when the control handle is created.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> that contains the required creation parameters when the handle to the control is created.
Gets the default size of the control.
Returns a <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> with a <xref href="System.Drawing.Size.Width"></xref> of 104 and a <xref href="System.Drawing.Size.Height"></xref> of 24.
Occurs when the user double-clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton"></xref> control.

By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ControlStyles.StandardClick> style bit is set to `false` for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> control, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.DoubleClick> event is not raised.
Occurs when the user double-clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton"></xref> control with the mouse.

By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ControlStyles.StandardClick> style bit is set to `false` for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> control, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.MouseDoubleClick> event is not raised.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckBox.CheckedChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.OnCheckedChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click"></xref> event.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.AutoCheck%2A> property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.Checked%2A> property is set to `true` when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> control is clicked.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Enter"></xref> event.

If the user enters the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> control by using the arrow keys, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> will raise the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnHandleCreated(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseUp"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton.OnMouseUp%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Generates a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click"></xref> event for the control, simulating a click by a user.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ProcessMnemonic(System.Char)"></xref> method.
The character to process.
`true` if the character was successfully processed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can give the focus to this control using the TAB key.
`true` if the user can give focus to this control using the TAB key; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the alignment of the text on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton"></xref> control.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.ContentAlignment"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Drawing.ContentAlignment.MiddleLeft"></xref>.
The value assigned is not one of the <xref href="System.Drawing.ContentAlignment"></xref> values.
Overrides the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component.ToString"></xref> method.
A string representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton"></xref> that indicates whether it is checked.
